lead_paragraph: A thriving industry allows West Bank residents to get past what Israelis call a security barrier. It has a dangerous side effect: Attackers sneak through as well.

byline.contributor: Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By JAMES GLANZ and RAMI NAZZAL

headline.print_headline: A Way Into Israel to Work or Fight
headline.main: Smugglers in West Bank Open Door to Jobs in Israel, and Violence

snippet: A thriving industry allows West Bank residents to get past what Israelis call a security barrier. It has a dangerous side effect: Attackers sneak through as well.
abstract: Interviews with over two dozen Palestinians reveals workings of thriving smuggling industry that transports people from West Bank to Israel, over wall built to deter suicide bombers during second intifada; industry has come under scrutiny due to shooting of four people in Tel Aviv by two Palestinian men, who used similar mode of ingress.
